subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






April 19, 2007

TOP STORIESKiller's Video Reveals Deep-Seated Rage
Two days after the worst killing spree in U.S. history, videos and photographs of Cho Seung-Hui that were mailed to NBC between
                        killings stunned the Virginia Tech community and the country. "Now you have blood on your hands," he said in the video. More...Watch: 'You Forced Me Into A Corner'
• Gonzales: Firings Proper And Should Stand• Gates In Iraq: Patience Running Out
                     					| Watch• CBS Poll: 36% Say Gonzales Should QuitU.S.New Pet Food Worry: Contaminated Rice
The FDA says the industrial chemical previously found to have contaminated wheat bran and caused the recall of over 100 pet
                        food brands is now believed to have contaminated rice protein concentrate, also imported from China. More...
• Killer's Video Reveals Deep-Seated Rage
                     					| Watch• Wounded Student: I Forgive Gunman
                     					| Watch• Story Behind Famous Virginia Tech Photo
                     					| Watch• More StoriesWorldGates In Iraq: Patience Running Out
Defense Secretary Robert Gates has arrived for his third visit to Iraq with a message that American patience for the war is
                        wearing thin. He arrived hours after a suicide bomber killed 12 people, and relatives mourned more than 230 killed Wednesday.
                         More...Watch: Has The Troop Increase Helped?
• Police Hunt Suspect In Peace Corps Death• Turkey Detains 5 In Bible Shootings• Crucial Iraq Oil Law Set For Parliament• More StoriesPoliticsCBS Poll: 36% Say Gonzales Should Quit
According to a new CBS News Poll, over a third of Americans think Attorney General Alberto Gonzales should resign or be removed.
                        But nearly two-thirds of those who are closely following the firings flap do not think Gonzales is telling the truth. More...
• Gonzales: Firings Proper And Should Stand• High Court Upholds Ban On Some Abortions
                     					| Watch• Bush Threatens Sudan Over Darfur Bloodshed• More StoriesHealthDoes Cervical Cancer Vaccine Benefit Last?
Two vaccines for preventing cervical cancer, one that is already available and another that is undergoing FDA review, continue
                        to offer nearly 100% protection five years following administration, new research shows. More...
• New Pet Food Worry: Contaminated Rice• Hormone Use Linked To Higher Cancer Risk• Possible Aid For Alzheimer's: Satellites• More StoriesSciTechMySpace Enters Online News Business
The popular online social networking site MySpace is entering the news business with a feature that lets its users determine
                        what items other members see. As part of the service, MySpace will pull and display headlines from the outside news sites. More...
• Cars Still Beat SUVs In Safety• Antwerp Zoo: Don't Stare At That Chimp• Gunman's Cyber World To Be Revealed
                     					| Watch• More StoriesBusinessCars Still Beat SUVs In Safety
When comparing the death rates in passenger vehicles with similar weight, cars are still safer than SUVs and pickup trucks.
                        But the insurance industry finds that SUVs and pickups are catching up with cars, due to electronic stability control.  More...
• MySpace Enters Online News Business• BlackBerry Outage Leaves Thumbs Idle• New Pet Food Worry: Contaminated Rice• More StoriesEntertainment"American Idol" Says So Long, Sanjaya!
The reality show's unlikely star was finally voted off the show this week. More...Watch: Simon Cowell Gets Judged
• Lindsay Lohan: I'm Not An Addict• Kitty Carlisle Hart Dies At 96• Governor Mulls Pardon For Jim Morrison  • More StoriesOpinionGuns And Abortions
CBSNews.com's Dick Meyer says those two newly-reignited arguments won't be resolved anytime soon. "We aren't polarized,
                        we are pluralized," Meyer says. More...
• CBS Poll: 36% Say Gonzales Should Quit• Making No Sense Of It All
                     					| Watch• Iraq On Edge
                     					| Watch• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Story Behind Famous Virginia Tech Photo
The image of senior Kevin Sterne being carried off has been seen worldwide. It captures the drama of the moment, and has come
                        to be seen as the iconic photo from that tragic day. Kelly Wallace reports. More...Watch: 'You Forced Me Into A Corner'

Rare Tiger Cubs Make DebutCBS News RAW: An Australian zoo has introduced two rare Sumatran tiger cubs to the public, after they were born in
                                    captivity  as part of a global breeding program to save the species.
